snippet: Workers raced to stop the leakage at the Fukushima Daiichi plant, but its operator said much of the water had seeped into the soil and the source of the leak was unknown.
abstract: Operator of Japan's stricken Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant admits that three hundred tons of highly contaminated water leaked from storage tank, prompting regulators to declare radiological release incident for first time since disaster struck there in 2011; officials acknowledge that tainted water could eventually reach the ocean, adding new fears of environmental calamity.
lead_paragraph: Workers raced to stop the leakage at the Fukushima Daiichi plant, but its operator said much of the water had seeped into the soil and the source of the leak was unknown.

headline.main: Tank Has Leaked Tons of Contaminated Water at Japan Nuclear Site
headline.print_headline: Tank Has Leaked Tons of Contaminated Water at Japan Nuclear Site
